doc.title: Cerro de Pasco: The Forgotten City
doc.plot: Pasco, a mining city in the Peruvian Andes is one of the poorest and most polluted cities throughout the world. Everyday their citizens, especially children, suffer the impact of lead in blood and TNT explosions, and other abuses of the Peruvian mining enterprise Volcan. Latest studies made in kids concerning lead in blood, detected that a great number of them have higher rates of lead surpassing those accepted levels dictated by the World Health Organization (WHO). In Pasco, lead pollution has caused to the mining enterprise Volcan an accumulation of artificial mountains made of useless minerals in front of housing.
